message: Simplenote for jotting down ideas, Dropbox for quick, easy cloud storage, a good Twitter client like Twittlelator or Twitteriffic, and a podcast client like Podcaster or Instacast.
Oh, and get Instapaper. It lets you save links to articles so you can read them later.
Zumocast is great. You can stream your music library seamlessly over wi-fi and download any mp3's into the app to listen to offline. Such a great app. :)
Check out my app Living Earth HD.  It's a world clock and weather app.
+1 for everything DustDaughter recommended. Add Pastebot, 1password, Reeder, and TextExpander.

Twitter if you use Twitter, Evernote if you use Evernote, 1Password if you use 1Password, Facebook if you use Facebook, Angry Birds if you never want to get anything done ever again.  Instapaper.  If you're into photography at all, Hipstamatic is pretty much endless fun.  Instagram is less on the photography, more on the sharing, still fun.  Due is great for quick reminders (must remember before leaving in morning, must remember in 30mins, etc).

Here are my first screen apps I use daily or very often: Goodreader: read & annotate PDFs, spreadsheets, docs. // Evernote: "my second-brain". // 2Do: productivity app. // Beejive: consolidates all IM except Skype // Skype: well, for Skyping. // Hootsuite: for Twitter, Facebook // Facebook: nuff said. // WhatsApp: texting for free to US & Europe peers who have the app, as I'm in Canada. // Boxcar: instant notifications for whatever. // Posterous: managing my Posterous accounts and groups, to publish posts through it if I'm not using email to publish via Posterous. // AbbleDabble: scrabble-like game, love it! // "How To Cook Everything" (mark bittman): simply brilliant cooking app! :-)
And one more: Camera+: dig it for shooting pics & editing, esp the timer function for shooting friends/family with me running around to get in the shot :-)

Parker in DC, LA & NYC tells you real time where the empty, paid parking spots are. This app has made going to Hollywood and finding the last parking spot available possible. I cannot wait for when this app works in SF!
Boxcar for keeping track of your Push notification timelines. WhatsApp for chat with friends.
